title: Israel Oppressed in Egypt
summary: Exodus 1 begins with the descendants of Jacob multiplying greatly in Egypt. A new Pharaoh, who did not know Joseph, enslaves the Israelites and orders the killing of Hebrew baby boys to control their population.

faq.question: Why did the new Pharaoh oppress the Israelites?
faq.answer: He feared their growing numbers and potential alliance with Egypt’s enemies.

faq.question: What was Pharaoh’s command regarding Hebrew babies?
faq.answer: He ordered that all newborn Hebrew boys be thrown into the Nile.
